pr_title: GEODE-8627: Redis not unsubscribing and punsubscribing correctly when no channel/pattern provided

timeline.message: GEODE-8627: Redis not unsubscribing and punsubscribing correctly when no channel/pattern provided

timeline.bodyText: It might make sense to move these tests to AbstractPubSubIntegrationTest.java once 8577 is resolved.
timeline.author: sabbey37

replies.bodyText: Do we not already have similar tests in AbstractPubSubIntegrationTest? Perhaps testUnsubscribingImplicitlyFromAllChannels and testPunsubscribingImplicitlyFromAllChannels
replies.author: jdeppe-pivotal

replies.bodyText: We do have a test that only subscribes to channels and then unsubscribes without an argument. We did not have a test that subscribes to channels and psubscribes to patterns, then unsubscribes without an argument (or punsubscribes without an argument).  We were incorrectly unsubscribing from everything (channels and patterns) when punsubscribe or unsubscribe were called without an argument.  Native Redis will only unsubscribe from channels (not patterns) if unsubscribe is called without an argument or punsubscribe only from patterns (not channels) if punsubscribe is called without an argument.
replies.author: sabbey37

timeline.bodyText: I can see that you want the method name to be more expressive, but I don't think it's good practice to have an API where some methods return null depending on what type of object you're using. That opens the door for a dev to easily make a mistake. I'd prefer to keep a single method but give it a more descriptive name. Perhaps getSubscriptionName() or getChannelOrPattern().
timeline.author: jdeppe-pivotal

replies.bodyText: I'm definitely open to suggestions on this.  The main reason this method was created and the getChannelName() method was changed was to unsubscribe from only channels or only patterns as appropriate.  We could always distinguish a channel from a pattern in other ways.  What do you think is best?
replies.author: sabbey37
jdeppe-pivotal

replies.bodyText: Good idea, I just pushed a change. Let me know what you think!
replies.author: sabbey37

timeline.bodyText: Only if you need to push another change: I think this should be findSubscriptionNames and the double ; at the end of the line. No biggy.
timeline.author: jdeppe-pivotal

replies.bodyText: Yes!  Thank you for pointing this out!
replies.author: sabbey37

timeline.bodyText: Also no biggy, but for enum equality it's slightly better to use == since it's also null safe. Under the covers the JDK ends up doing == in any case.
timeline.author: jdeppe-pivotal

replies.bodyText: Good to know! I'll update it.
replies.author: sabbey37
